Dialogue.NPCText:
You stand before a stern man clad in lacquered armor, his posture rigid as a drawn bow. His eyes weigh you with the discipline of a lifetime in command.

“I am Shogun Ryuji Takamura, sworn guardian of Hinokami and the Tokuno people. State your purpose, traveler: do you come with respect, or with trouble?”

Option.text: I wish to aid Hinokami, Shogun.
I bring news of the Verdant Tribes.
Tell me of your people’s struggle.
Tell me about yourself, Shogun Takamura.
I come in peace, just passing through.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Shogun’s eyes narrow, searching for signs of deceit.

“Many claim friendship in these times, but few act. Minax’s shadow creeps even here, twisting both heart and blade.

Hinokami stands on the brink of war with the Verdant Tribes—ancient lands, now battlegrounds. If you truly wish to help, mediation or courage may be needed. Will you serve as my envoy?”

Option.text: I will act as your envoy.
Why do the tribes oppose you?
How does Minax threaten us here?

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Shogun inclines his head—a rare gesture.

“Go then. Speak with Chieftain Kaelor, but beware his wrath and pride. Seek common ground, for Minax profits from our division.
Return with either treaty or tidings, and Hinokami will remember your service.”

The Shogun’s expression hardens.

“Speak then—do you bring threats, pleas, or perhaps a path to peace? The tribes have raided our hunters and defiled our shrines, yet I sense greater forces at play.”

Option.text: Minax cultists stir trouble among them.
I cannot help at this time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Minax is cunning. Her cultists whisper to the weak and desperate—tribes, exiles, even our own. Shamans dream of fire and blood. Some among my samurai have vanished, only to return with foreign eyes.
Our war is not just of steel, but of the spirit. If you see corruption, expose it.”

Option.text: How can I root out Minax’s agents?
I wish to discuss the tribes.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Shogun lowers his voice.

“A shadowed figure—Yumi, the ninja—reports a Minax cultist hidden among the shrine keepers. Find Yumi in the bamboo groves at dusk; bring evidence, and justice will follow.”

Option.text: I will seek out Yumi the Silent Wind.
I am not suited for espionage.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Do not fail. Minax’s poison seeps deeper than the blade. Trust your wits—and return with proof, not rumor.”

“Long ago, the Verdant Tribes roamed freely—before Hinokami’s founding. We claim what is needed for our survival; they see only invasion.
Yet, I would see peace, if the tribes will halt their attacks and respect our shrines. Mediation may yet be possible.”

Option.text: Why not crush them by force?

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Shogun’s tone grows cold.

“I have seen too much blood spilled in Tokuno’s name. Honor is not found in slaughter. Minax would rejoice if we lost our souls while gaining empty victory. Diplomacy is strength, so long as it is returned in kind.”

Option.text: I respect your wisdom. I will try to mediate.
I still believe force is needed.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Shogun glares.

“Return when you understand the cost of reckless war. Until then, keep your steel sheathed in Hinokami.”

The Shogun’s jaw tightens.

“So, my suspicions were true. If Minax twists their shamans, both our peoples are endangered. We must root out this influence—by stealth or steel.”

Option.text: What would you have me do?
I am not the right person.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“When Minax ravaged the Tokuno Isles, I led our survivors here. We built Hinokami on discipline, not conquest. My wife, Lady Aiko, tends to our people’s spirit, while I defend the body.
Yet our roots are fragile in this new soil, and enemies circle us. I trust in Bushido and the wisdom of allies—if they prove themselves.”

Option.text: I wish to help Hinokami stand strong.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Lady Aiko keeps our traditions alive. She seeks understanding, even with the tribes. If you wish to help, speak to her—she often knows where peace may be brokered, or where Minax’s touch has sown strife.”
“The cherry blossom shrine. Lady Aiko will be tending the lanterns or speaking with druids. She will welcome a respectful visitor.”

The Shogun folds his arms.
“Then see you bring no trouble to my gates. Hinokami watches all who pass.”

Option.text: Perhaps I could help after all.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Shogun folds his arms behind his back and gazes toward the east.

“Before I was Shogun, I was simply Ryuji of the Takamura clan. Born to a house of warriors on the Tokuno coast. I held my first blade at seven. I buried my first brother at eight—Minax’s fire saw to that.”

He exhales slowly.
“Ask what you will. The past still walks with me.”

Option.text: What is your relationship with Lady Aiko?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Tokuno was a land of balance: honor in battle, peace in art. We trained in blade and brush alike. But Minax brought nothing but ash.”

He lowers his head briefly.
“We who escaped were few. We brought only what we could carry: memories, traditions... and vengeance.”

“Hinokami is my answer to her fire.”

Option.text: Did you ever return to Tokuno?
What does that vengeance look like now?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I returned once. The land still burns in places. The spirits cry louder than the wind. It is not Tokuno—it is a scar that remembers.”

“We must build anew, not chase ghosts.”

“I would not shame my ancestors by seeking only blood. Vengeance through survival. Through discipline. Through the preservation of what Minax could not destroy.”
“But if her agents step foot in Hinokami...”
His voice becomes steel.
“Then my blade will remember.”

Option.text: I will help you defend your people.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“My eldest brother, Takeshi, died defending our shrine. My younger sister, Hana, was taken—never found.”
His jaw clenches.
“I was too young to help. Too weak. That shame built the man you see now.”

“If Minax still holds her... I would do what must be done.”

Option.text: You carry their memory with honor.

Option.action: SendMessage:'A new quest may someday reveal Hana’s fate...'

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Aiko was once a shrine maiden. She kept the light alive while I steeled myself in darkness.”

He allows a rare smile.
“Where I lead with discipline, she leads with compassion. It is she who taught me that the blade need not sever every disagreement.”
“Still, she remains the stronger of us.”

Option.text: You speak of her with deep respect.
Do you always agree on policy?
Perhaps I will visit her shrine.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Rarely. She advocates peace more than I believe wise. But when we do agree, it is because fate demands unity.”

“She seeks a joint festival with the Verdant Tribes. I allow it—for now.”
He grunts.
“Convince me it will not be our undoing, and I will back it more fully.”

Option.text: I’ll speak to her about the festival.
Option.action: SendMessage:Seek Lady Aiko at the cherry blossom shrine.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“She welcomes all who show respect. You may find her lighting lanterns beneath the falling blossoms. Do not mistake her grace for weakness.”

“She is fire wrapped in silk.”

Option.action: SendMessage:Lady Aiko awaits at the shrine.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“My mission is unchanged: to preserve the Tokuno spirit, protect Hinokami, and oppose Minax wherever her shadow falls.”
“But I am not blind to diplomacy. If peace preserves lives, I will pursue it—blade sheathed.”

“You now know more than most. What will you do with that knowledge?”

Option.text: Remember it, and honor your cause.
